title: 113_s2995
content: The Act may be cited as the "Clean Water Compliance and Affordability Act" and includes an Integrated Municipal Stormwater and Wastewater Approach Framework. The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency will work with municipalities to develop integrated plans for wastewater and stormwater management in a cost-effective manner. The pilot program will follow the Integrated Municipal Stormwater and Wastewater Approach Framework. Eligible municipalities will be selected to participate in the program. The Administrator, in consultation with States with approved NPDES programs, will select at least 15 eligible municipalities for a pilot program. An eligible municipality is a government entity that holds a NPDES permit or is under a compliance agreement with the Clean Water Act. The Administrator will prioritize eligible municipalities for the pilot program based on factors such as compliance with the Federal Water Pollution Control Act and affordability constraints in addressing wet weather discharges. The Administrator may prioritize eligible municipalities for a pilot program based on their efforts in developing integrated and adaptive clean water management practices, including the use of innovative approaches. Approval of Integrated Plans under the pilot program involves considering the financial capability of eligible municipalities to meet Federal Water Pollution Control Act requirements. The pilot program aims to assist eligible municipalities in implementing innovative and flexible approaches to meet their obligations under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The Administrator may work closely with selected municipalities to ensure cost-effective and environmentally beneficial outcomes. The pilot program aims to assist eligible municipalities in implementing innovative and flexible approaches to meet their obligations under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. Selected municipalities can extend permit terms, modify consent decrees, and provide regulatory flexibility to encourage adaptive approaches in integrated plans. The Administrator will report to Congress annually on the results of the pilot program established to reduce compliance costs under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act for eligible municipalities.
